title: Beauty Standards Through History
description: A 60-second lesson on Beauty Standards Through History.

hook.text: In Renaissance Europe, a pale, plump woman was the ideal beauty. In 2020s America, it's the opposite.

buildup.text: Beauty standards shift radically by era. What's irresistible in one century is unremarkable in the next.

discovery.text: Tanned skin signaled poverty (outdoor labor) until the 1920s. Coco Chanel made suntans fashionable overnight.

twist.text: The only constant across all eras: symmetry and clear skin. Everything else â€” weight, tone, shape â€” fluctuates.

climax.text: Beauty isn't timeless. It's a cultural snapshot â€” a reflection of who holds power and what they value.

punchline.text: Every era invents its own version of 'beautiful.'

quiz.question: What are the only consistent beauty preferences across all eras?
